result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Spahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered in the amount of $213,530 and to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.  Court makes a specific finding that the defendant does have the ability to pay resitution.

    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Defendant is not to operate or start a business.
Defendant is not to have any financial responsibilities as it pertains to employment responsibilities.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
FIRST 90 DAYS TO BE SERVED AT HUBER.  
NEXT 90 DAYS TO BE SERVED THROUGH DAY REPORT PROGRAM.
Last 6 months are STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility no later than 6:00 p.m. on 07-06-2015.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 2.
Courts costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 2.
Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 2.

records.addlTxt:
David William Maas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael Spahr in court with attorney James Walrath.  
Defendant has paid $25,000 in up front restitution.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.


Term of Probation: 7 Years.
Concurrent to:  Counts 3, 4 & 5.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant not to operate or start  a business.
Defendant not to have any financial responsibilities as it pertains to employment responsibilities.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $213,530.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Court makes a specific finding that defendant does have the ability to pay the restitution.

Costs:  $268
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to Serve the first 90 days at the Huber Facility - Second 90 Days to be served through Day Report Program.
Last 6 Months - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion. 
Defendant to report to the huber facility no later than 6:00 p.m. on: 07/02/15
